description:
And we start with the huge bomb attack on a government security complex in Syria's second city Aleppo. Dozens of security forces and rebel fighters were killed in the explosion which was so big residents said it shook most of the city. Rebels have been trying to capture Aleppo for more than two years now. Edward Dark is a journalist in the city.

"Well, it's quieting down now, but obviously a few hours ago there was a large explosion which shook the whole city. Inside the houses the fridges and the furniture were shaking because it was such a powerful shock, and I think it, even registered on earthquake meters, it was that powerful. Basically was a tunnel dug on the northwest approach of Aleppo city where that's the frontline where the regime has the Air Force Intelligence headquarters which basically now just a large barracks and concentration of troops. And then that was attacked through the use of digging tunnels and then blowing them up, which is actually a tactic the rebels fighting Aleppo have been using effectively for quite a long time now. So basically they dug that tunnel up to the fortifications of the intelligence building and then they blew it up, and then there was an attack."
